itemBody.p: Look at the content and the formatting of the text in the following paragraph. Each part of the text is labelled with a number, in sequence. A system fails if (a) any of the numbered parts are missing; (b) a part does not run in with the previous text; (c) any part fails to be rendered in the way described (this is stricter than the requirement in HTML) or (d) there is no horizontal rule between this paragraph and the next. Non-visual systems, by definition, cannot support these elements.

[1] plain text: the appearance of the following parts must be distinguishable from plain text in the manner described.[2]: bold text, [3]: big text, [4] italic text, [5] small text, [6] subscripted text, [7] superscripted text, [8] monospaced text, [9] bold italic text . [10] plain text: end of paragraph.
